etymology.description: 苓(苓) (líng, "medicinal plant") is a variant form of 蓮(蓮) (lián, "lotus") -> stylized form developed from original
etymology.interpretation: 苓(苓) (líng, "medicinal plant") retains its association with plants and healing due to its formation as a variant of characters related to plants, such as 蓮(蓮) (lián, "lotus"). Although it serves a different function by referring specifically to a medicinal fungus, its roots lie in a shared thematic component of plants and health.

examples.chinese: 医师用苓煎成汤剂(醫師用苓煎成湯劑)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshī yòng líng jiān chéng tāng jì.
examples.english: The doctor decocted the poria to make a herbal soup.

examples.chinese: 中药中常用苓(苓)，来调理健脾(來調理健脾)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngyào zhōng cháng yòng líng, lái tiáolǐ jiànpí.
examples.english: Poria is often used in traditional Chinese medicine to improve spleen function.
